Pharmacies have to lock up controlled substances - yet the same rules don't apply to gun shops that sell deadly weapons. My bill, the Gun Theft Prevention Act, would change that.

This is simple: less gun theft means less guns on our streets and in the hands of violent criminals. https://twitter.com/teamtrace/status/1128268928885694465 …

Right now, gun shops are not even required to do as little as lock their doors at night, let alone take any extra precautions to prevent theft and ensure their guns don’t fall into the wrong hands. This is unacceptable.

That's why I introduced the Gun Theft Prevention Act. pic.twitter.com/2X0REqa0oA

Last year, a gun store in Rochester was burglarized twice in the same week. This is negligent, it is dangerous, and it's why I’m so proud to introduce the Gun Theft Prevention Act to strengthen regulations for gun shops and help #EndGunViolence. pic.twitter.com/WAdb9JjhVm

In partnership with the Army Corps of Engineers, we need long-term planning and investment that will improve the ability of our community, and others like it across the nation, to withstand, recover, and adapt to these weather-related events.
